poem:
Title: Upon the Stars and Human Folly

Atop the star-climbing spire,
man's ego sways and reels.
Swathed in raw ambition's fire,
he forgets the flesh still feels.
Amongst the SpaceX ascenders,
harsh winds of jest and jibe,
in their bitter laughter renders
a pain no joke can bribe.
In the quest for cosmic glory,
let us remember thus,
each crewman has a story,
more divine than any of us.
